p: Thymol is a monoterpene found in essential oils extracted from plants belonging to the Lamiaceae family such as the genera Thymus, Ocimum, Origanum, Satureja, Thymbra, and Monarda [ 65â€“ 67]. This molecule is a phytoconstituent with several biological activities described, including anti-inflammatory and antinociceptive [ 68], local anesthetic [ 69], and antifungal and antibacterial [ 70] activities. Thymol has been reported to have strong antifungal activity against strains of the Candida genus, acting on the fungal cell membrane and producing a synergistic effect when used with nystatin to inhibit the growth of these strains [ 36].
